intro: Elsholtzia hoffmeisteri, commonly known as Hoffmeister's elsholtzia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a fragrant scent. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
